channel.title: Ask an "Amurican"
channel.description:
Obviously my beliefs don't represent those of all Americans, so I welcome other Americans to post their responses here too.
Here's a quick summary of my beliefs; First, I hate Bush. He's an idiot. I have no idea how he got elected twice. Second, our government blows and is too corrupt to be reformed. Third, the average American is a dumbass. That's not to say there aren't smart people here, but we have a lot of dumbasses. Third, I think our government's anti-communism crusade is retarded. It seems so hypocritical to me that we (meaning our government and the rednecks) try to tell other countries how to govern their country when our own has gone to shit. Fourth, in America, the rich control the country. Politicians are nothing but puppets. Recently the supreme court (I think it was them at least) voted to allow private corporations to donate limitless sums of money to presidential ad campaigns. This means that now not only can pharmaceutical companies buy senators and congressmen, they can also buy the president.
I think Obama means good, but he's too pussy-whipped by big corporations to accomplish anything let alone achieve the "change" he promised. But McCain was far far worse, and Palin makes me want to puke.

item.title: Ask an "Amurican"
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Mr. Someguy:

Hey, you. Seattle guy. Is this accurate:

I’m going to be a bit exasperating here and respond with a: “Yes and no.” or a “Partially.”

Marb went from Seattle to a desert state. I have a little different perspective. I grew up in Baltimore, which is not known for its rain but it actually gets more rain per year than Seattle does, but I’ll tell you the truth, as I know it here:

For about 8-9 months of the year, we’re under a constant threat of light drizzle/sprinkles. However, it’s not uncommon to see the sun. If you turn on the news, there’s always rain icons for the weather, but it might mean you get five minutes of sprinkles, 6 hours of overcast and an hour of broken sky where sun can peek through on occasion. Right now, we’re getting filtered sun.

The rest of the year (around summer): stunningly clear skies and bright sunshine.

In Baltimore, you had longer bouts of sunshine, but the storms were more torrential, bringing lots more rain than Seattle ever gets. I can’t remember the last time Seattle had a really bad rain storm. Which sucks because I missed the bad rain storms from growing up in Baltimore.

Yes, it does rain a lot here, but I haven’t seen the “rusts, molds or grows green shit on it” like Marb was suggesting. Also, the standard of living is high…if you live in or very close to downtown Seattle or Bellevue. However, I got a nice 1BR apartment for $620/month and I’m one bus from downtown Seattle. If that’s a higher standard of living, then it’s offset by the highest minimum wage in the country.

And, yes, Seattle has its ghettos, but there are sometimes funny things to read in the graffiti at those bus stops. I read message-board like responses back and forth down a wall one time. “seattle is a bunch of f****ts” “ur just upset u dont have a girl liek me” “fuck u” “no thanks im not gay liek u” “Hey! Learn spelling and capitalization!”

I lol’d.

Read full topic

item.title: Ask an "Amurican"
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
danielsangeo:

:facepalm:

lern2joke

Hey, you. Seattle guy. Is this accurate:

Marb:

Until 9 months ago, I lived my entire life within 50 miles of Seattle (35 years). I never really noticed how much it actually does rain there til I moved to a desert state. We hardly ever got huge downpours, but it could drizzle off and on for 60 days straight. Imagine this: in WA, everything rusts, molds or grows green shit on it if it’s left outside unprotected. Seemed normal to me at the time…
Oh, and there are rain forests on the Olympic Peninsula in Washington. So, if you moved to Seattle, you wouldn’t be very far from one. Overall, WA is a very beautiful place to visit. Sucks to live there with the rain and all (high standard of living, too), but would definitely recommend a visit.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
NakedRobber:

I’m up in Vancouver and while we were hosting the Olympics everyone from down south seemed to be pretty friendly once they got up here. Hopefully the Bush era is finally over and America can go back to being respected for what its good at: making funny movies and driving pick up trucks in the city for no reason.

Hopefully the Bush era is finally over and America can go back to being respected for what its good at: making funny movies and driving pick up trucks in the city for no reason.

item.title: Ask an "Amurican"
item.dc:creator: DansonDelta40
item.description:
No, I rather facepalm.

Did I pass?

I admit, I am also arrogant and stupid in many different subjects. But I try not to be and am not content with this status quo. Dunno if that makes me any better - I just feel better that way.

Read full topic

item.title: Ask an "Amurican"
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Danson:

That’s okay. Americans, by and large, are stupid. Stupid people are fine (I’m stupid in a lot of subjects). It’s the arrogance of many Americans (“It’s the best country on Earth!”) coupled with stupidity that causes, in my opinion, this stereotype to exist.

And, before anyone says that arrogance+stupidity is not a part of the existence of this stereotype needs to get more educated about the arrogant stupidity of too many Americans.

But then again, arrogant stupidity is not simply an American trait. I see it in other nationalities as well. As you say, Danson, about many Germans.

Here’s a test to see if you’re arrogant and stupid:

Do you laugh, smirk, chuckle, or otherwise at this:
“You know those black box recorders they have on planes? The ones that are virtually indestructible? Why don’t they make the ENTIRE PLANE like that?”

Read full topic

item.title: Ask an "Amurican"
item.dc:creator: DansonDelta40
item.description:
I hate prejudices of all kinds. When most uneducated Germans see an American on TV doing something stupid, they laugh out loud: “Hahaaaa stupid Americans!”
But when they see an American doing or saying something intelligent, they mumble: “You know, for an American, he is fairly decent.”

Always implying that Americans are a bunch of dumbasses. And, what is worse, implying that nothing SO DUMB could EVER happen in Germany.
…
Uh, hellooo? Need a history lesson fellow Germans? God, even with history aside, many German politicians are an embarrassment for the whole nation anyway. So what the fuck are we laughing about? Grrrr sometimes I hate my own people sooo much…

Well, at least the stupid ones that buy every bullshit the TV and the BILD magazine (equivalent to THE SUN or FOX NEWS on paper, sort of) show them.

I mean, just because some private TV channels often show hilarious scenes from American TV shows, many Germans now think that the people on the “Jerry Springer Show” are representative of the American people. It’s the old “haha we are better than them” attitude, and most of us are falling for it, apparently. Sad, very sad.

Read full topic
